The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include new credits for flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicles and qualified alternative fuel motor vehicles. Subsections are reorganized to accommodate these new credits. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include new credits for flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicles and qualified alternative fuel motor vehicles. Subsections are reorganized to accommodate these new credits, with the new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicle credit determined under subsection (e) and the new qualified alternative fuel motor vehicle credit determined under subsection (f). The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include new credits for flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicles and qualified alternative fuel motor vehicles. The new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicle credit is determined under subsection (e) for a new hybrid flexible fuel motor vehicle placed in service by the taxpayer during the taxable year. The credit amount is determined based on a table provided in the legislation. The credit amount for a vehicle with city fuel economy between 125-225% of a comparable vehicle ranges from $1,500 to $3,500. The city fuel economy of a vehicle for the credit is determined on an E-85 ethanol gallon equivalent basis, while the comparable vehicle's fuel economy is determined on a gasoline gallon equivalent basis. The term 'new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicle' is defined in this subsection. The term 'new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicle' refers to a qualified hybrid vehicle capable of running on alternative fuel, gasoline, or any blend of both, certified by the EPA. A new qualified hybrid motor vehicle is defined as capable of operating on alternative fuel, gasoline, or any blend, certified by the EPA to achieve a city fuel economy using E-85 ethanol at least 125% of a comparable nonhybrid vehicle. The manufacturer achieved a city fuel economy using E-85 ethanol at least 125% of a comparable nonhybrid vehicle. Subsection (d) does not apply to vehicles eligible for the new qualified hybrid motor vehicle credit. Extension of termination for section 30B of the Code is amended. Extension of termination for section 30B of the Code is amended to include a new deadline for new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicles. The vehicles included in the numeric limitation are specified in paragraph (1) of section 30B(g) of the Code. The extension of termination for section 30B of the Code now includes a new deadline for new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicles. This amendment also specifies the vehicles included in the numeric limitation. The amendment expands the scope of section 30B of the Code to include new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicles and makes conforming amendments to subsections (i) and (k) by updating references to subsections (f), (h), and (g). The amendment expands section 30B of the Code to include new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicles and updates references in subsection (k). The amendment expands section 30B of the Code to include new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicles and updates references in subsection (k). Subsection (e) is modified to include new qualified hybrid motor vehicles, subsection (b) is amended to update references. The Code is amended to update references in subsections (b) and (e), with changes to subsection (k) for new flexible fuel hybrid motor vehicles. Effective December 31, 2006, the amendments apply to property placed in service after that date.
